title: Monuments of Mars stuff
content:
I've put some Monuments of Mars stuff on my [url=http://www.student.tue.nl/u/a.f.smeijers/sfp/]site[/url]. Including maps of all 80 levels, an unused picture and more cheats than you'll find on other pages.

If you've never heard of this game before. Play it now, because it has gargs [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] in it.Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

content:

title: Re: Monuments of Mars stuff
content:
Great work! The game was real fun but way too hard. Ehrm where is this Garg?

upd. Don't tell me. I found him [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] .[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] But what's the big deal with those gargs anyaway? I mean are they the second famous creature in the whole universe? They are so famous here... One of my favorite creatures are the Bloogs [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ----

title: Re: Monuments of Mars stuff
content:

Garg garg garg garg garg garg garg garg garg garg!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-crazy.gif[/img]
For me they're the most famous creature. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [url=http://www.keengrid.net/]keengrid.net[/url]

title: Re: Monuments of Mars stuff
content:
Monuments of Mars too hard? It's a really easy game, because you have unlimited lives (the first Apogee that has this feature).

Monuments of Mars takes place on Mars just like Keen 1. That's why there are gargs in both games. I wonder if there is a garg in Doom 3 (Doom 3 takes place on Mars, right?).Groeten van Frenkel
Visit [url=http://www.sfprod.cjb.net]The Official S&F Prod. Homepage[/url]

title: Re: Monuments of Mars stuff
content:
(Forgive me for posting on an old topic)

Is it officially a Garg? Like LL said, it doesn't look like a garg.

At any rate, I have never played the Doom games (I'd love to, but they aren't freeware, and I hate paying for PC games), but it would be an awesome homage to Keen if they did have a Garg in it.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: Monuments of Mars stuff
content:
I don't think the enemies have official names, but those creatures do look an awful lot like Gargs if you ask me.
I say they're the same species, just rendered with a different graphics technology.

You can download the shareware Doom version, which is basically free.
If you like it, you can always buy the full version to it and/or Doom II.
(What's wrong with paying for PC games, as long as the price is right, but since Doom is old you should be able to find it cheap, if you're lucky to find it in stores at all.)
Anyway, no Gargs in Doom I'm afraid.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Monuments of Mars stuff
content:
Doom II is available in many department stores on PC for only AUD$5. However, the entire trilogy is kinda rare (it can be found at EB Games) for around AUD$10-20.

I saw the GBA version recently and it was a whopping AUD$70. Forget it! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] -- Censorship is F**ked! --

title: Re: Monuments of Mars stuff
content:
Then the CGA Dopefish isn't the same species as the regular Dopefish either.
What about cats... panthers are a group of cats consisting of numerous species.
I stand by my opinion.

Hmmm, quickly looking for an image of the CGA-fish I went to Dopefish.com, and it seems I actually missed an update somewhere... the Pocket PC theme and the screwing-up-of-a-sentence-somewhere are new for me.
Probably he forgot to update the "Last updated" thingymabob... nothing big in the update the department though.
Then again, could've been I just forgot, ages ago, because the PPC theme isn't even accessible through that URL anymore.

So... same species, and don't you say otherwise. :P

Oh, and I just bough Doom Collector's Edition for 15,- in the Bart Smit store.
I would've preferred a slightly lower cost, but I never officially owned Doom back in the day I think, and I'm filthy rich anyway.
(Or was that a part of that one nice dream... I can never remember.)Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

"A whole different color? Butterflies look awfully alike too, as do most members of the cat family. They're different species."

Hmm... Let's use obvious facts to prove you wrong... Cat's of the same species can have black/brown/white fur, dogs are the same...

For that matter:

I like a girl who is Filipeano. She has red skin, black hair, and the oddest eyes I've ever seen (Though still quite beautiful). So, because she's a different color than me, that means she's a seperate species? Of course not!

You might say sub-species, but w/e.

title: Re: *"*"*"*"*"
content:
They're not just a different colour, but of different morphology. Its like sying all butterflies are the same species because they all have wings and six legs.
